intro: Helichrysum albicans, commonly known as the silver leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic leaves. Its flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their long-lasting nature. Helichrysum albicans thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
